channel.title: Data Analysis Projects on HR
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis Projects on HR

item.title: GDP Analysis
item.description: Challenge 2:GDP components over time and among countries To look at the differences in GDP accross countries, we have focussed on Germany, India, and USA. In order to gain a better understanding of their components and trends, we have sorted, cleaned, and filtered the data before plotting the relevant data points in the charts that follow: UN_GDP_data <- read_excel(here::here("data", "Download-GDPconstant-USD-countries.xls"), # Excel filename sheet="Download-GDPconstant-USD-countr", # Sheet name skip=2) # Number of rows to skip To make the data easier to handle, we have changed the figures, renamed the indicators and pivoted the data.

item.title: IMDB Analysis
item.description: IMDB ratings: Differences between directors Examining the IMDB rating and focusing on the mean ratings for Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton, we initially reproduced the given plot before doing further calculations to determine the validity of the comparison. Reproducing the graph and running hypothesis tests on the differences between ratings of Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton: Our null and alternate hypotheses are: H0: The difference in the mean IMDB ratings for Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton is equal to zero H1: The difference in the mean IMDB ratings for Steven Spielberg and Tim Burton is not equal to zero
